<ix:footnote xml:lang="en-us" id="f203dd6f1-cc92-4b01-877e-6a3a9cd69845">The market value of the assets held in the trust for the non-qualified deferred compensation program is included as an asset and as a liability as the trust&#x2019;s assets are both assets of the Company and also a liability as they are available to general creditors in certain circumstances.</ix:footnote>
<ix:footnote xml:lang="en-us" id="fe9e38b74-a996-4af1-a29d-8efa30a762b3">Common stock equivalents not included in the computation of diluted earnings per share because the impact would have been anti-dilutive were 0 shares for the three month periods ended December 31, 2018 and 2019, and 8 shares and 2 shares for the nine months ended December 31, 2018 and 2019, respectively.</ix:footnote>
<ix:footnote xml:lang="en-us" id="f822f9174-72bd-41da-be38-a63454b56522">Foreign currency derivatives in the form of forward contracts are included in prepaid and other assets or accrued expenses in the consolidated balance sheets. Unrealized gains and losses on derivatives designated as cash flow hedges are recorded in other comprehensive income (loss). Realized gains and losses on derivatives designated as cash flow hedges and gains and losses on derivatives not designated as hedges are recorded in other income.</ix:footnote>

   <td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:top;width:100%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
  </tr>

   <td colspan="3" style="vertical-align:top;border-bottom:solid 1px #000000;;width:100%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;">(<ix:nonNumeric name="dei:CityAreaCode" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31">864</ix:nonNumeric>) <ix:nonNumeric name="dei:LocalPhoneNumber" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31">967-2150</ix:nonNumeric></p> </td>

<p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is a large accelerated filer, an accelerated filer, a non-accelerated filer, a smaller reporting company, or an emerging growth company. See the definitions of &#x201c;large accelerated filer,&#x201d; &#x201c;accelerated filer,&#x201d; &#x201c;smaller reporting company,&#x201d; and &#x201c;emerging growth company&#x201d; in Rule 12b-2 of the Exchange Act.</p>

      <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; padding-bottom: 3px;">&#xa0;</td>

   </table>
  </div>

   </table>
  </div>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 22.2pt;text-align:center;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 22.2pt;text-align:center;">See accompanying notes to consolidated financial statements.</p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 22.2pt;text-align:center;">&#xa0;</p>
  <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
   <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     7
   </div>
   <hr />
   <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
     &#xa0;
   </div>
  </div>
  <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 22.2pt;text-align:center;"><b><a id="notes" title="notes" href=""></a>AVX Corporation and Subsidiaries</b></p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 22.2pt;text-align:center;"><b>Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Unaudited)</b></p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 22.2pt;text-align:center;">(in thousands, except per share data)</p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"><b>&#xa0;</b></p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410746" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1.</em> Basis of Presentation:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The consolidated financial statements of AVX Corporation and its subsidiaries (&#x201c;AVX&#x201d; or the &#x201c;Company&#x201d;) include all accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries. All significant intercompany transactions and accounts have been eliminated. The Company&#xa0;has&#xa0;prepared the accompanying financial statements pursuant to the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201c;SEC&#x201d;) for interim financial reporting. These consolidated financial statements are unaudited and, in the opinion of management, include all adjustments, consisting of normal recurring adjustments and accruals, necessary for the fair statement of the consolidated balance sheets, operating results, comprehensive income, statements of stockholders&#x2019; equity and cash flows for the periods presented. Operating results for the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019 </em>are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> necessarily indicative of the results that <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>be expected for the fiscal year ending <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2020 </em>due to changes in economic conditions and other factors. Certain information and footnote disclosures normally included in financial statements prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States have been omitted in accordance with the rules and regulations of the SEC for interim financial statements. These consolidated financial statements should be read in conjunction with the audited consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes included in our Annual Report on Form <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10</em>-K for the fiscal year ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i></i></p><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:UseOfEstimates" id="c55018225" escape="true"><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</i></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We have identified the accounting policies and estimates that are critical to our business operations and understanding our results of operations. Those policies and estimates can be found in Note <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1,</em> &#x201c;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies,&#x201d; of the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements and in &#x201c;Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates,&#x201d; in &#x201c;Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#x201d; contained in our Annual Report on Form <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10</em>-K for the fiscal year ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019. </em>Accordingly, this Quarterly Report on Form <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10</em>-Q should be read in conjunction with our Annual Report on Form <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10</em>-K for the fiscal year ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019. </em>During the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>there were <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> significant changes to any critical accounting policies or to the methodology used in determining estimates including those related to investment securities, inventories, goodwill, intangible assets, property and equipment, and contingencies.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">During the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month period ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>goodwill increased by $<ix:nonFraction id="c55012471" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:GoodwillTranslationAndPurchaseAccountingAdjustments" scale="3">7,720</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;due to the purchase of Chengdu OK New Energy ("COKNE") partially offset by foreign currency translation.&#xa0;</p></ix:nonNumeric><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i></i></p><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:PriorPeriodReclassificationAdjustmentDescription" id="c55018226" escape="true"><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Reclassifications</i></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Certain amounts in the prior year consolidated financial statements have been reclassified to the current year presentation. The impact of the reclassifications made to prior year amounts is <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> material and did <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> affect net income.</p></ix:nonNumeric><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i></i></p><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="c55018227" escape="true"><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Relevant New Accounting Standards</i></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016,</em> the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02,</em> &#x201c;Leases&#x201d;. This guidance changes the requirements for inclusion of certain right-of-use assets and the associated liabilities to be included in a statement of financial position. The Company adopted this guidance effective <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2019, </em>using the modified retrospective method and utilized the optional transition method under which the Company will continue to apply the legacy guidance in Accounting Standards Codification (&#x201c;ASC&#x201d;) <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">840,</em> including its disclosure requirements, in the comparative period presented. In addition, the Company elected the package of practical expedients permitted under the transition guidance which permits the following: a) carrying forward the historical lease classification, b) <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> separating lease components from non-lease components within the Company&#x2019;s facility lease contracts, c) <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> presenting comparative periods but rather recording a cumulative catch-up during fiscal <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2020,</em> and d) electing, by asset class, <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> to record on the balance sheet a lease whose term is <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">twelve</em> months or less including reasonably certain renewal options. As a result of the adoption of ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02</em> for the fiscal year beginning <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2019, </em>the Company recorded initial operating lease right-of-use assets of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55012485" contextRef="i_2019-04-01_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis-AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" scale="3">18,351</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and related operating lease liabilities&#xa0;of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55012486" contextRef="i_2019-04-01_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis-AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" scale="3">18,053</ix:nonFraction>. Right-of-use assets are included in &#x201c;Other assets&#x201d; on the Company&#x2019;s Balance Sheet as of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019. </em>Lease liabilities are classified as current and non-current, and are included in &#x201c;Accrued expenses&#x201d; and &#x201c;Other liabilities&#x201d;, respectively, on the Company&#x2019;s Balance Sheet as of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019. </em>Please refer to Note <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em> for additional information.</p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
    <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"></em>
    </div>
   </div>
   <ix:exclude>
    <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
     <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
      <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">8</em>
     </div>
     <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
     <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
       &#xa0;
     </div>
    </div> <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p></ix:exclude>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left"></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> June 2016, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13,</em> &#x201c;Financial Instruments &#x2013; Credit Losses: Measurements of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments.&#x201d; This standard requires the measurement and recognition of expected credit losses held at amortized cost. This new standard replaces the use of forward-looking information to estimate credit losses and requires credit losses for available for sale debt securities to be recorded through an allowance for credit losses rather than a reduction in the amortized cost basis. This update is effective for public companies for annual reporting periods beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2019. </em>Management has performed a preliminary assessment of the potential impact of the adoption of ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13,</em> and believes that the financial impact would <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> be material. The adoption of the standard will result in additional disclosure requirements, and updating of our policies and procedures. The Company intends to adopt the standard utilizing the modified retrospective approach, effective <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2020.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> August 2017, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12,</em> &#x201c;Derivatives and Hedging.&#x201d; The standard aims to align the designation and measurement guidance for qualifying hedging relationships and the presentation of hedge results for cash flow and fair value hedge accounting with risk management activities. The guidance is effective for public companies for annual reporting periods beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2018, </em>and interim periods within those annual periods. Additionally, in <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> October 2018, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">16,</em> &#x201c;Derivatives and Hedging (Topic <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">815</em>): Inclusion of the Secured Overnight Financing Rate (SOFR) Overnight Index Swap (OIS) Rate as a Benchmark Interest Rate for Hedge Accounting Purposes&#x201d;, which permits use of the OIS rate based on the SOFR as a U.S. benchmark interest rate for hedge accounting purposes under Topic <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">815.</em> This update is effective for public companies for annual reporting periods beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2018, </em>and interim periods within those annual periods. For entities that had&#xa0;<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> yet adopted ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12,</em> the concurrent adoption of ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">16</em> is required. The Company concurrently adopted ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12</em> and ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">16</em> effective <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2019. </em>The adoption of these standards has <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> had a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> February 2018, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02,</em> "Income Statement - Reporting Comprehensive Income." This standard allows a reclassification from accumulated other comprehensive income to retained earnings for stranded tax effects resulting from the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2017.</em> The standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2018, </em>including interim periods within those fiscal years and early adoption is permitted. The Company adopted ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">02</em> effective <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2019 </em>and elected to <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> reclassify the income tax effects of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act from accumulated other comprehensive income to retained earnings. The adoption of this standard has <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> had a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> August 2018, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13,</em> &#x201c;Fair Value Measurement &#x2013; Disclosure Framework &#x2013; Changes to the Disclosure Requirements for Fair Value Measurement.&#x201d;&#xa0;This standard removes, adds and modifies certain disclosure requirements in the existing framework. ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> removes the following disclosure requirements: (i) the amount of and reasons for transfers between Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em> and Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em> of the fair value hierarchy and (ii) the entity&#x2019;s valuation processes for Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em> fair value measurements. ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> adds the following disclosure requirements: (i) provide information about the measurement uncertainty of Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em> fair value measurements as of the reporting date rather than a point in the future, (ii) disclose changes in unrealized gains and losses related to Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em> measurements for the period included in other comprehensive income, and (iii) disclose for Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em> measurements the range and weighted average of the significant unobservable inputs and the way it is calculated. ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13</em> is effective for fiscal years, and interim periods within those fiscal years, beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2019. </em>Early adoption is permitted. The Company does <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> expect this ASU to have a material impact on our consolidated financial statements and disclosures.&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> August 2018, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">14,</em> &#x201c;Compensation &#x2013; Retirement Benefits &#x2013; Defined Benefit Plans &#x2013; General.&#x201d; This standard removes certain disclosures that are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> considered cost beneficial, clarifies certain required disclosures and added additional disclosures. The standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2020, </em>and early adoption is permitted. The amendments in ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">14</em> would need to be applied on a retrospective basis. Management is&#xa0;currently assessing the impact ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">14</em>&#xa0;will have on our disclosures.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> August 2018, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">15,</em> &#x201c;Customer&#x2019;s Accounting for Implementation Costs Incurred in a Cloud Computing Arrangement That is a Service Contract.&#x201d;&#xa0;This guidance reduces the complexity for the accounting for costs of implementing a cloud computing service arrangement and aligns the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred in a hosting arrangement that is a service contract with the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred to develop or obtain internal-use software (and hosting arrangements that include an internal-use software license). This update is effective for public companies for annual reporting periods beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2019, </em>and interim periods within those fiscal years. Early adoption is permitted. The Company early adopted this standard effective <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2019, </em>utilizing the prospective approach to all implementation costs incurred after the date of adoption. The adoption of ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">15</em> has <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> had a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 2019, </em>the FASB issued ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12,</em> "Income Taxes: Simplifying the Accounting for Income Taxes." This guidance removes certain exceptions to the general principles of ASC <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">740</em> in order to reduce the cost and complexity of its application. This guidance is effective for annual reporting periods beginning after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 15, 2020, </em>including interim periods within those fiscal years, with certain amendments applied on a modified retrospective basis, with a cumulative-effect adjustment to retained earnings as of the beginning of the fiscal year of adoption, and others prospectively. Early adoption of this guidance is permitted, including the adoption in any interim period for public companies for which financial statements have <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> yet been issued. Management is currently assessing the impact&#xa0;ASU <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019</em>-<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12</em> will have on our consolidated financial statements and disclosures.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We have reviewed other newly issued accounting pronouncements and concluded that they are either <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> applicable to our business or that <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> material effect is expected on our consolidated financial statements as a result of future adoption.</p></ix:nonNumeric><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"></p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;"></p>
   <ix:exclude><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p>
    <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
     <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
      <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">9</em>
     </div>
     <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
     <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
       &#xa0;
     </div>
    </div> <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p></ix:exclude>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left"></p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeasesTextBlock" id="c1410747" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2.</em> Leases:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">As discussed in Note <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1,</em> the Company&#xa0;adopted the new leasing standard using the modified retrospective approach with an effective date of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 1, 2019. </em>Prior year financial statements were <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> recast under the new standard and, therefore, those amounts are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> presented below. We elected the package of transition provisions available for expired or existing contracts, which allowed us to carry forward our historical assessments of (<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em>) whether contracts are or contain leases, (<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em>) lease classification and (<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em>) initial direct costs.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The Company&#x2019;s operating leases consist of automobiles, machinery and equipment, and real estate, including office, storage and parking spaces. The duration of these leases range from <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="i_2019-12-31_RangeAxis-MinimumMember" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" id="c55012560" format="ixt-sec:duryear">1</ix:nonNumeric> to <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="i_2019-12-31_RangeAxis-MaximumMember" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" id="c55012561" format="ixt-sec:duryear">15</ix:nonNumeric>&#xa0;years. The Company has <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> financing lease arrangements. For leases with terms greater than <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12</em> months, the Company recorded the related right-of-use asset and lease liability at the present value of lease payments over the term. Leases with a term <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12</em> months or less at inception are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> recorded on our Consolidated Balance Sheet and are expensed on a straight-line basis over the lease term in our Consolidated Statement of Operations. Some of our leases contain variable rental escalation clauses which are recognized when incurred. Additionally, some of our leases contain renewal options and/or termination options that are factored into the determination of lease payments and lease terms when it is reasonably certain that the Company will exercise these options. The Company recognizes lease expense for these leases on a straight-line basis over the lease term. For leases beginning in fiscal year <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2020</em> and later, we account for lease components (e.g., fixed payments including rent, real estate taxes and insurance costs) separately from the non-lease components (e.g., common area maintenance costs).</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">When available, we use the rate implicit in the lease to discount lease payments to present value; however, most of our leases do <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> provide a readily determinable implicit rate. Therefore, we must estimate our incremental borrowing rate to discount the lease payments based on information available at lease commencement. Our incremental borrowing rate is based on a credit-adjusted risk-free rate at commencement date, which best approximates a secured rate over a similar term of lease.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The following table presents our lease balances:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

       <td style="width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;"><ix:nonFraction id="c55012598" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:ShortTermLeaseCost" scale="3">784</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr style="background-color: rgb(204, 238, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Variable lease cost</p> </td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>

   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The Company paid $<ix:nonFraction id="c55012568" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeasePayments" scale="3">2,019</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55012569" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeasePayments" scale="3">6,110</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;for its operating leases in the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> months ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>respectively which are included in operating cash flows on the consolidated statement of cash flows. The weighted-average remaining lease term for the Company&#x2019;s operating leases is <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="i_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseWeightedAverageRemainingLeaseTerm1" id="c55012572" format="ixt-sec:duryear">4.6</ix:nonNumeric>&#xa0;years and the weighted-average discount rate is <ix:nonFraction id="c55012573" contextRef="i_2019-12-31" unitRef="Pure" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="4" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseWeightedAverageDiscountRatePercent" scale="-2">3.25</ix:nonFraction>% as of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"><b>&#xa0;</b></p>

   </ix:nonNumeric>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;"><ix:exclude>&#xa0;</ix:exclude></p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:EarningsPerShareTextBlock" id="c1410752" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3.</em> Earnings per Share:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Basic earnings per share are computed by dividing net earnings by the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding for the period. Diluted earnings per share are computed by dividing net earnings by the sum of (a) the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding during the period and (b) the dilutive effect of potential common stock equivalents during the period. Stock options and unvested service-based RSU awards make up the common stock equivalents and are computed using the treasury stock method.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The table below represents the basic and diluted earnings per share and sets forth the weighted average number of shares of common stock outstanding and potential common stock equivalents for the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ending <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2018 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfEarningsPerShareBasicAndDilutedTableTextBlock" id="c1410753" escape="true">

      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">(<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em>)</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:93.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;">Common stock equivalents <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> included in the computation of diluted earnings per share because the impact would have been anti-dilutive were <ix:nonFraction id="c55012627" contextRef="d_2018-10-01_2018-12-31_AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareByAntidilutiveSecuritiesAxis-CommonStockEquivalentsMember" unitRef="Share" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareAmount" scale="3">0</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;shares for the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2018 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019,</em>&#xa0;and <ix:nonFraction id="c55012631" contextRef="d_2018-04-01_2018-12-31_AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareByAntidilutiveSecuritiesAxis-CommonStockEquivalentsMember" unitRef="Share" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareAmount" scale="3">8</ix:nonFraction> shares and <ix:nonFraction id="c55012632" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareByAntidilutiveSecuritiesAxis-CommonStockEquivalentsMember" unitRef="Share" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:AntidilutiveSecuritiesExcludedFromComputationOfEarningsPerShareAmount" scale="3">2</ix:nonFraction> shares for the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> months ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2018 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019,</em> respectively.</p> </td>

   </ix:nonNumeric>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Charges related to allowances for doubtful accounts are charged to selling, general and administrative expenses. Charges related to stock rotation, ship from stock and debit, sales returns, and sales discounts are reported as deductions from revenue. Please refer to Note <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10,</em> "Segment and Geographic Information," for disaggregated revenue information.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"></p><ix:exclude><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
    <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12</em>
    </div>
    <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
    <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
      &#xa0;</div></div></ix:exclude><div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt"><div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
    </div>
   </div>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" id="c1410760" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">5.</em> Fair Value:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Fair Value Hierarchy:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The fair value framework requires the categorization of assets and liabilities into <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> levels based upon the assumptions (inputs) used to value the assets or liabilities. Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em> provides the most reliable measure of fair value, whereas Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em> generally requires significant management judgment. The <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> levels are defined as follows:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="width:100%;text-indent:0;font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;">
    <tbody>
     <tr>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:12pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><sup>&#x25a0;</sup></p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:93.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i>Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em></i>: Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets and liabilities.</p> </td>
     </tr>
     <tr>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:93.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
     </tr>
     <tr>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:12pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><sup>&#x25a0;</sup></p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:93.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i>Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em></i>: Observable inputs other than those included in Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1.</em> For example, quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets or quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in inactive markets.</p> </td>
     </tr>
     <tr>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:93.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
     </tr>
     <tr>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:3.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:12pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><sup>&#x25a0;</sup></p> </td>
      <td style="vertical-align:top;width:93.3%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><i>Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">3</em></i>: Unobservable inputs reflecting management&#x2019;s own assumptions about the inputs used in pricing the asset or liability.</p> </td>
     </tr>
    </tbody>
   </table>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">During the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>there have been <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> transfers of assets or liabilities between levels within the fair value hierarchy.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 47%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><b>Liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis:</b></p> </td>

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 1%;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>

       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 9%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013003" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_FairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis-FairValueInputsLevel3Member_FairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis-FairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:zerodash" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyContractsLiabilityFairValueDisclosure" scale="3">-</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 47%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Total</p> </td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);">$</td>
       <td style="width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013004" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_FairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis-FairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesFairValueDisclosure" scale="3">5,173</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 3px; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);">$</td>
       <td style="width: 9%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013005" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_FairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis-FairValueInputsLevel1Member_FairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis-FairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesFairValueDisclosure" scale="3">3,977</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 3px; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);">$</td>
       <td style="width: 9%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013006" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_FairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis-FairValueInputsLevel2Member_FairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis-FairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesFairValueDisclosure" scale="3">1,196</ix:nonFraction></td>

       <td style="width: 9%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 3px double rgb(0, 0, 0);"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013007" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_FairValueByFairValueHierarchyLevelAxis-FairValueInputsLevel3Member_FairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis-FairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:zerodash" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LiabilitiesFairValueDisclosure" scale="3">-</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 3px; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
     </tbody>
    </table>
   </ix:continuation>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">(<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em>) The market value of the assets held in the trust for the non-qualified deferred compensation program is included as an asset and as a liability as the trust&#x2019;s assets are both assets of the Company and also a liability as they are available to general creditors in certain circumstances.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">(<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em>) Foreign currency derivatives in the form of forward contracts are included in prepaid and other assets or accrued expenses in the consolidated balance sheets. Unrealized gains and losses on derivatives designated as cash flow hedges are recorded in other comprehensive income (loss). Realized gains and losses on derivatives designated as cash flow hedges and gains and losses on derivatives <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> designated as hedges are recorded in other income.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Valuation Techniques:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The following describes valuation techniques used to appropriately value our assets held in the non-qualified deferred compensation plan and derivatives.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Assets held in the non-qualified deferred compensation plan</i></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Assets valued using Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">1</em> and Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em> inputs in the table above represent assets from our non-qualified deferred compensation program. The funds in the non-qualified deferred compensation program are valued based on the number of shares in the funds using a price per share traded in an active market.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Investments are considered to be impaired when a decline in fair value is judged to be other-than-temporary. If the cost of an investment exceeds its fair value, among other factors, we evaluate general market conditions, the duration and extent to which the fair value is less than cost, and whether or <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> we expect to recover the security's entire amortized cost. Once a decline in fair value is determined to be other-than-temporary, an impairment charge is recorded and a new cost basis in the investment is established.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><i>Derivatives</i></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We primarily use forward contracts, with maturities generally less than <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">four</em> months, designated as cash flow hedges, to protect against the foreign currency exchange rate risks inherent in our forecasted transactions related to purchase commitments and sales, denominated in various currencies. We also use derivatives <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> designated as hedging instruments to hedge foreign currency balance sheet exposures. These derivatives are used to offset currency changes in the fair value of the hedged assets and liabilities. Fair values for all of our derivative financial instruments are valued by adjusting the market spot rate by forward points, based on the date of the contract. The spot rates and forward points used are an average rate from an actively traded market. At <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>all of our forward contracts are valued using Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em> measurements.</p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"></p><ix:exclude><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
    <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">14</em>
    </div>
    <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
    <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
      &#xa0;
    </div>
   </div>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p></ix:exclude><p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left"></p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsInDebtAndMarketableEquitySecuritiesAndCertainTradingAssetsDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410765" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">6.</em> Financial Instruments and Investments in Securities:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">At <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>we classified investments in debt securities and time deposits as held-to-maturity securities.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Our long-term and short-term investment securities are accounted for as held-to-maturity securities and are carried at amortized cost. We have the ability and intent to hold these investments until maturity. All income generated from the held-to-maturity securities investments are recorded as interest income.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Investments in held-to-maturity securities, recorded at amortized cost, were as follows:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 52%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Short-term investments:</p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="text-align: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="text-align: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="text-align: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>

   </ix:continuation>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The amortized cost and estimated fair value of held-to-maturity investments at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>by contractual maturity, are shown below. The estimated fair value of these investments are based on valuation inputs that include benchmark yields, reported trades, broker and dealer quotes, issuer spreads, <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">two</em>-sided markets, benchmark securities, bids, offers, and reference data, which are Level <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2</em> inputs in the fair value hierarchy. Actual maturities <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>differ from contractual maturities because issuers <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>have the right to call or prepay obligations without call or prepayment penalties.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">Fair Value</em></b></p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr style="background-color: rgb(204, 238, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 68%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Due in one year or less</p> </td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">$</td>
       <td style="width: 13%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013059" contextRef="i_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:HeldToMaturitySecuritiesDebtMaturitiesWithinOneYearNetCarryingAmount" scale="3">390,170</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">$</td>
       <td style="width: 13%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013060" contextRef="i_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:HeldToMaturitySecuritiesDebtMaturitiesWithinOneYearFairValue" scale="3">390,499</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
     </tbody>
    </table>
   </ix:nonNumeric>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"><ix:exclude>&#xa0;</ix:exclude></p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:InventoryDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410769" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">7.</em> Inventories:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfInventoryCurrentTableTextBlock" id="c1410770" escape="true">

   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"></p><ix:exclude><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>

    <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">15</em>

    <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
