   </div>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p></ix:exclude><p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left"></p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410771" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">8.</em> Commitments and Contingencies:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We have been identified by the United States Environmental Protection Agency (&#x201c;EPA&#x201d;), state governmental agencies or other private parties as a potentially responsible party (&#x201c;PRP&#x201d;) under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation and Liability Act (&#x201c;CERCLA&#x201d;), or equivalent non-U.S., state or local laws, for clean-up and response costs associated with certain sites at which remediation is required with respect to prior contamination. Because CERCLA or such state statutes authorize joint and several liability, the EPA or non-U.S., state or local regulatory authorities could seek to recover all clean-up costs from any <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">one</em> of the PRPs at a site despite the involvement of other PRPs. At certain sites, financially responsible PRPs other than AVX also are, or have been, involved in site investigation and clean-up activities. We believe that liability resulting from these sites will be apportioned between AVX and other PRPs.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">To resolve our liability at the sites at which we have been named a PRP, we have entered into various administrative orders and consent decrees with federal and state regulatory agencies governing the timing and nature of investigation and remediation. As is customary, the orders and decrees regarding sites where the PRPs are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> themselves implementing the chosen remedy contain provisions allowing the EPA to reopen the agreement and seek additional amounts from settling PRPs in the event that certain contingencies occur, such as the discovery of significant new information about site conditions.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> June 3, 2010, </em>AVX entered into an agreement with the EPA and the City of New Bedford, pursuant to which AVX is required to perform environmental remediation at a site referred to as the &#x201c;Aerovox Site&#x201d; (the &#x201c;Site&#x201d;), located in New Bedford, Massachusetts. AVX has substantially completed its obligations pursuant to such agreement with the EPA and the City of New Bedford with respect to the satisfaction of AVX&#x2019;s federal law requirements. The Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection has jurisdiction over the balance of the environmental remediation at the Site although the EPA <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>have jurisdiction over some aspects of the overall remediation. AVX has submitted its proposed remedy, but until the state has approved such proposal, AVX cannot determine if additional groundwater and soil remediation will be required, if substantial material will have to be disposed of offsite, or if additional remediation techniques will be required, any of which could result in a more extensive and costly plan of remediation. Further, the Site and the remediation <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>be subject to additional scrutiny under other statutory procedures which could also add to the cost of remediation. During the year ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>we increased our estimated accrual for work to be done at the Site by $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013076" contextRef="d_2018-04-01_2019-03-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:AccrualForEnvironmentalLossContingenciesPeriodIncreaseDecrease" scale="3">8,312</ix:nonFraction> pursuant to discussions with the Massachusetts Department of Environmental Protection and our environmental engineers. We have a remaining accrual of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013077" contextRef="i_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:AccrualForEnvironmentalLossContingencies" scale="3">18,569</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>representing our current estimate of the potential liability related to the remaining performance of environmental remediation actions at the Site and neighboring properties using certain assumptions regarding the plan of remediation. Until all parties agree and remediation is complete, we cannot be certain there will be <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> additional cost relating to the Site.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We had total reserves of approximately $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013079" contextRef="i_2019-03-31_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionEnvironmentalMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" scale="3">26,371</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013080" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionEnvironmentalMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" scale="3">22,482</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>respectively, related to various environmental matters and sites, including those discussed above. These reserves are classified in the Consolidated Balance Sheets as $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013081" contextRef="i_2019-03-31_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionEnvironmentalMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualCarryingValueCurrent" scale="3">5,749</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013082" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionEnvironmentalMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualCarryingValueCurrent" scale="3">2,660</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;in accrued expenses at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>respectively, and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013083" contextRef="i_2019-03-31_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionEnvironmentalMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualCarryingValueNoncurrent" scale="3">20,622</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013084" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionEnvironmentalMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualCarryingValueNoncurrent" scale="3">19,822</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;in other non-current liabilities at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>respectively. The amounts recorded for identified environmental liabilities are based on estimates. Periodically, we review amounts recorded and adjust them to reflect additional legal and technical information that becomes available. Uncertainties about the status of laws, regulations, regulatory actions, technology, and information related to individual sites make it difficult to develop an estimate of the reasonably possible aggregate environmental remediation exposure. Accordingly, these costs could differ significantly&#xa0;from our current estimates.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 19, 2016, </em>the Canadian Ministry of the Environment and Climate Change (the &#x201c;MoE&#x201d;) issued a Director&#x2019;s Order naming AVX Corporation, and others, as responsible parties with respect to a location in Hamilton, Ontario that was at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">one</em> time the site of operations of Aerovox Canada, a former subsidiary of Aerovox Corporation, a predecessor of AVX. AVX has taken the position that any liability of Aerovox Canada for such site under the laws of Canada cannot be imposed on AVX. At present, it is unclear whether the MoE will seek to enforce such Canadian order against AVX, and whether, in the event it does so, AVX will have any liability under applicable law. AVX intends to contest any such course of action that <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>be taken by the MoE.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">In connection with the same location, Union Gas Limited and Coca-Cola Refreshments Canada Company filed suits in the Superior Court of Justice for Ontario, Canada, against AVX Corporation, Aerovox Corp. and Cooper Industries, LLC seeking to recover the costs of remediation of the site and for damages associated with alleged contamination of the site. Those suits were filed on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 18, 2018, </em>but <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> served on AVX until <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> October 11, 2018, </em>and are in their initial stages. AVX is considering its legal options but intends to vigorously defend these matters.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We also operate, or did at <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">one</em> time, on other sites that <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>have potential future environmental issues as a result of activities at sites during AVX&#x2019;s long history of manufacturing operations or prior to the start of operations by AVX. Even though we <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>have rights of indemnity for such environmental matters at certain sites, regulatory agencies in those jurisdictions <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>require us to address such issues. Once it becomes probable that we will incur costs in connection with remediation of a site and such costs can be reasonably estimated, we establish reserves or adjust our reserves for our projected share of these costs. A separate account receivable is recorded for any indemnified costs. Our environmental reserves are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> discounted and do <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> reflect any possible future insurance recoveries, which are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> expected to be significant, but do reflect a reasonable estimate of cost sharing at multiple party sites or indemnification of our liability by a <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">third</em> party.</p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:exclude><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;"></p>
    <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
     <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
      <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">16</em>
     </div>
     <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
     <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
       &#xa0;
     </div>
    </div> <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p></ix:exclude>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left"></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> involved in any pending or threatened environmental proceedings that would require curtailment of our operations. We continually expend funds to ensure that our facilities comply with applicable environmental regulations. While we believe that we are in compliance with applicable environmental laws, we cannot accurately predict future developments and do <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> necessarily have knowledge of all past occurrences on sites that we currently occupy. New environmental regulations <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>be enacted and we cannot determine the modifications, if any, in our operations that any such future regulations might require, or the cost of compliance with such regulations. Moreover, the risk of environmental liability and remediation costs is inherent in the nature of our business and, therefore, there can be <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">no</em> assurance that material environmental costs, including remediation costs, will <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> arise in the future.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 25, 2013, </em>AVX was named as a defendant in a patent infringement case filed in the United States District Court for the District of Delaware captioned <i>Greatbatch, Inc. v. AVX Corporation</i>. This case alleged that certain AVX products infringe on <ix:nonFraction id="c55013097" contextRef="d_2013-04-25_2013-04-25_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionPatentInfringementMattersMember_RangeAxis-MinimumMember" unitRef="Pure" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="INF" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyPatentsAllegedlyInfringedNumber" scale="0">one</ix:nonFraction> or more of <ix:nonFraction id="c55013098" contextRef="d_2013-04-25_2013-04-25_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionPatentInfringementMattersMember_RangeAxis-MaximumMember" unitRef="Pure" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="INF" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyPatentsAllegedlyInfringedNumber" scale="0">six</ix:nonFraction> Greatbatch patents. On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> January 26, 2016, </em>the jury returned a verdict in favor of the plaintiff in the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">first</em> phase of a segmented trial and a mixed verdict in the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">second</em> phase of a segmented trial, and found damages to Greatbatch in the amount of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013101" contextRef="d_2015-04-01_2016-03-31_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-5" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyDamagesAwardedValue" scale="3">37,500</ix:nonFraction>, which was recorded in fiscal <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2016.</em> That verdict was later vacated by the court on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 30, 2018. </em>In fiscal <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018,</em> we recorded a favorable accrual adjustment of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013104" contextRef="d_2017-04-01_2018-03-31_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-5" name="avx:LossContingencyAccrualAdjustment" scale="3">1,500</ix:nonFraction> related to this patent infringement case. In a new trial, the amount of damages (excluding interest) was determined by a jury to be $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013105" contextRef="d_2019-01-15_2019-01-15_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-5" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyDamagesAwardedValue" scale="3">22,100</ix:nonFraction> on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> January 15, 2019 </em>resulting in a favorable accrual adjustment of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013106" contextRef="d_2018-04-01_2019-03-31_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-5" name="avx:LossContingencyAccrualAdjustment" scale="3">13,900</ix:nonFraction> for the year ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019. </em>During the year ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>the Company made a payment of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013107" contextRef="i_2019-03-31_BalanceSheetLocationAxis-OtherAssetsMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-5" name="us-gaap:EscrowDeposit" scale="3">22,100</ix:nonFraction> to an escrow account which is classified within &#x201c;Other assets&#x201d;. Additionally, during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> months ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>the Company made a payment of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013109" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_BalanceSheetLocationAxis-OtherAssetsMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:EscrowDeposit" scale="3">5,646</ix:nonFraction>, representing pre-judgement interest,&#xa0;to an escrow account which is classified within "Other assets". The matter is now on appeal, the outcome of which could result in a material impact to the accrual for this case in the future.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> September 2, 2014, </em>a subsidiary of AVX, American Technical Ceramics (&#x201c;ATC&#x201d;), was named as a defendant in a patent infringement case filed in the United States District Court of the Southern District of California captioned<i> Presidio Components, Inc. v. American Technical Ceramics Corp</i>. This case alleged that certain ATC products infringe on a Presidio patent. On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> April 18, 2016, </em>the jury returned a verdict in favor of the plaintiff and found damages to Presidio. On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> August 17, 2016, </em>the court issued a permanent injunction prohibiting ATC from manufacturing or selling the related products after <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> November 16, 2016. </em>Subsequently, on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> October 21, 2016, </em>the Federal Circuit Court granted AVX&#x2019;s request for a stay of the permanent injunction whereby ATC was allowed to continue to sell the disputed product until <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 17, 2017 </em>to anyone who was a customer prior to <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> June 17, 2016. </em>Any sales subsequent to <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> November 16, 2016 </em>pursuant to the stay of the permanent injunction were subject to court mandated intellectual property damages for each product sold. In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 2017, </em>a panel of the Federal Circuit vacated the damage award to Presidio, vacated the injunction, and remanded the case for further proceedings to determine damages limited to &#x201c;reasonable royalties&#x201d; and to reconsider the requested injunction in light of its opinion and any additional facts. In <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> June 2018, </em>the District Court set the amount of royalties and re-issued the injunction. The appeals from the royalties and the injunction were denied by the Federal Circuit Court in <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> November 2019. </em>Accordingly, the Company recorded a reduction of the accrual of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013110" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31_LitigationCaseAxis-PresidioComponentsVAmericanTechnicalCeramicsCorpMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualCarryingValuePeriodIncreaseDecrease" sign="-" scale="3">11,664</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> months ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019. </em>The remaining accrual balance as of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019 </em>was $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013114" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_LitigationCaseAxis-PresidioComponentsVAmericanTechnicalCeramicsCorpMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" scale="3">25,919</ix:nonFraction>.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">As of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>we had total reserves of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013115" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationMember_LossContingenciesByNatureOfContingencyAxis-UnfavorableRegulatoryActionPatentInfringementMattersMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="INF" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" scale="0">48,019</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;plus accrued interest in accrued expenses with respect to the <ix:nonFraction id="c55013116" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_LitigationCaseAxis-GreatbatchIncVAVXCorporationAndPresidioComponentsVAmericanTechnicalCeramicsCorpMember" unitRef="Pure" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="INF" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyPendingClaimsNumber" scale="0">two</ix:nonFraction> intellectual property cases discussed above. The amounts recorded are based on estimated outcomes. Amounts recorded are reviewed periodically and adjusted to reflect additional information that becomes available. Accordingly, these costs could differ significantly from our current estimates.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">During calendar year <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2014,</em> AVX was named as a co-defendant in a series of cases filed in the United States and in the Canadian provinces of Quebec, Ontario, British Columbia, Saskatchewan and Manitoba alleging violations of United States, state and Canadian antitrust laws asserting that AVX and numerous other companies were participants in alleged price-fixing in the capacitor market. The cases in the United States were consolidated into the Northern District of California on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> October 2, 2014. </em>Some plaintiffs have broken off from the United States class action and filed actions on their own, although AVX is <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> named in all of these independent actions. The cases in Canada have <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> been consolidated. These cases are still in progress. AVX believes it has meritorious defenses and intends to vigorously defend the cases. The class action case is currently scheduled for trial in the Spring or Summer of <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2020.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We are involved in other disputes, warranty, and legal proceedings arising in the normal course of business. While we cannot predict the outcome of these other disputes and proceedings, we believe, based upon a review with legal counsel, that <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">none</em> of these other disputes or proceedings will have a material impact on our financial position, results of operations, comprehensive income (loss), or cash flows. However, we cannot be certain of the eventual outcome in these or other matters that <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> may </em>arise and their potential impact on our financial position, results of operations, comprehensive income (loss), or cash flows.</p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;"></p>
   <ix:exclude><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:left;">&#xa0;</p>
    <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
     <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
      <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">17</em>
     </div>
     <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />

       &#xa0;
     </div>
    </div></ix:exclude>
   <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">

   </div>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomeNoteTextBlock" id="c1410772" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">9.</em> Comprehensive Income (Loss):</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Comprehensive income (loss) represents changes in equity during a period except those resulting from investments by and distributions to shareholders. The specific components include net income, pension liability and other post-retirement benefit adjustments, deferred gains and losses resulting from foreign currency translation adjustments and unrealized gains and losses on qualified foreign currency cash flow hedges.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Other comprehensive income (loss) includes the following components:&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfComprehensiveIncomeLossTableTextBlock" id="CB1DB9FB-569B-4950-A9B5-3A44EAB9A22B" escape="true" continuedAt="c0F5622B1-71C2-4D04-B1A3-1D987C145B85">

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">Pre-tax</em></b></p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&#xa0;</td>

      <tr style="background-color: rgb(204, 238, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 44%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Foreign currency translation adjustment</p> </td>

       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">$</td>
       <td style="width: 11%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">(<ix:nonFraction id="c55013153" contextRef="d_2018-10-01_2018-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:OtherComprehensiveIncomeLossForeignCurrencyTransactionAndTranslationAdjustmentBeforeTax" sign="-" scale="3">18,639</ix:nonFraction></td>

   </ix:continuation>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Amounts reclassified out of accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) into net income include those that pertain to the Company&#x2019;s pension and postretirement benefit plans and realized gains and losses on derivative instruments designated as cash flow hedges. Please see Note <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">11</em>&#xa0;for additional information related to the amortization of prior service cost and the recognized actuarial losses, which amounts are reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) into net income and are included in selling, general and administrative expenses in the statement of operations during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2018 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019.</em> Please see Note <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12</em>&#xa0;for additional information related to realized gains and losses on derivative instruments reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) into net income during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2018 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"><b>&#xa0;</b></p>
   <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
    <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">18</em>
    </div>
    <hr />
    <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
      &#xa0;
    </div>
   </div>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410775" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">10.</em> Segment and Geographic Information:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b>&#xa0;</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Our operating segments are based on the types of products from which we generate revenues. We are organized into a product line organization with <ix:nonFraction id="c55013202" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="Pure" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="INF" name="avx:NumberOfProductGroups" scale="0">four</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;product groups and <ix:nonFraction id="c55013203" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="Pure" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="INF" name="us-gaap:NumberOfReportableSegments" scale="0">two</ix:nonFraction> reportable segments. The reportable segments have been presented in accordance with the SEC's aggregation criteria and quantitative thresholds. The aggregation criteria consist of similar economic characteristics, products and services, production processes, customer classes, and distribution channels. Our <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">four</em> product groups are: Ceramic Components;&#xa0;Tantalum Components;&#xa0;Advanced Components;&#xa0;and Interconnect,&#xa0;Sensing and&#xa0;Control Devices. Historically,&#xa0;KED Resale&#xa0;reported as its own product group, but it has now been combined with Advanced Components. The reportable segments are: Electronic Components and&#xa0;Interconnect, Sensing and Control Devices. The product groups of Ceramic, Tantalum, and&#xa0;Advanced Components have been aggregated into the Electronic Components reportable segment in accordance with the SEC&#x2019;s aggregation criteria and quantitative thresholds. The Electronic Components segment consists primarily of surface mount and leaded ceramic capacitors, RF thick and thin film components, surface mount and leaded tantalum capacitors, polymer tantalum capacitors, surface mount and leaded film capacitors, ceramic and film power capacitors, super capacitors, EMI filters (bolt in and surface mount), thick and thin film packages of multiple passive integrated components, varistors, thermistors, inductors, resistive products, and passive and active electronic antennas and antenna systems&#xa0;manufactured by us or purchased from other manufacturers for resale. The Interconnect, Sensing and Control Devices segment consists primarily of automotive sensing and control devices and automotive, telecom, and memory connectors manufactured by or for AVX. Sales and operating results from these reportable segments are shown in the tables below. In addition, we have a corporate administration group consisting of finance, legal, environmental, health &amp; safety, and administrative activities.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We evaluate performance of our segments based upon sales and operating profit. There are <ix:nonFraction id="c55013205" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_ConsolidationItemsAxis-IntersegmentEliminationMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerIncludingAssessedTax" scale="0">no</ix:nonFraction> intersegment revenues. We allocate the costs of shared resources between segments based on each segment&#x2019;s usage of the shared resources. Cash, accounts receivable, investments in securities, and certain other assets, which are centrally managed, are <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> readily allocable to operating segments.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The tables below present information about reportable&#xa0;segments:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfSegmentReportingInformationBySegmentTextBlock" id="E883DFBA-4BA4-4948-890D-25009EC5BECD" escape="true" continuedAt="c6B7B47F5-1ED1-4E4A-88BE-5A2F39757687">

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 52%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><b>Sales Revenue:</b></p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td colspan="2" style="text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: 1px solid rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2018</em></b></p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&#xa0;</td>

   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The following geographic data is based upon net sales generated by operations located within particular geographic areas. Substantially all of the sales in the Americas region were generated in the United States.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; padding-bottom: 3px;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
     </tbody>
    </table>
   </ix:nonNumeric>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"></p><ix:exclude><p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
    <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">20</em>
    </div>

    <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
      &#xa0;</div></div></ix:exclude><div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt"><div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">

   </div>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
  <div>
    &#xa0;

  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:PensionAndOtherPostretirementBenefitsDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410780" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">11.</em> Pension Plans:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Net periodic pension cost for our defined benefit plans consisted of the following for the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2018 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2019:</em></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

   </ix:continuation>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Based on current actuarial computations, during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> months ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>we made contributions of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013327" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis-ForeignPlanMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="avx:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerContributionAmount" scale="3">933</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;to the international plans. We expect to make additional contributions of approximately $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013328" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis-ForeignPlanMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanExpectedFutureEmployerContributionsNextFiscalYear" scale="3">140</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;to the international plans over the remainder of fiscal <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2020.</em> We made <ix:nonFraction id="c55013330" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="-3" name="avx:DefinedContributionPlanEmployerContributionAmount" scale="3">no</ix:nonFraction> contributions to the U.S. plans during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> months ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019. </em>We expect to make <ix:nonFraction id="c55013332" contextRef="i_2019-12-31" unitRef="USD" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:DefinedBenefitPlanExpectedFutureEmployerContributionsNextFiscalYear" scale="3">no</ix:nonFraction> contributions to the U.S. plans the remainder of fiscal <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">2020.</em></p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <div>
    &#xa0;
  </div>
  <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsAndHedgingActivitiesDisclosureTextBlock" id="c1410783" escape="true">
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">12.</em> Derivative Financial Instruments:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We are exposed to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations in the normal course of business. We use derivative instruments (forward contracts) to hedge certain foreign currency exposures as part of our risk management strategy. The objective is to offset gains and losses resulting from these exposures with gains and losses on the forward contracts used to hedge them, thereby reducing volatility of earnings or protecting fair values of assets and liabilities. We do <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> enter into any derivative financial instruments for trading or speculative purposes.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We primarily use forward contracts, with maturities less than <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"><span style="-sec-ix-hidden:c55013408">four</span> months</em>, to protect against the foreign currency exchange rate risks inherent in our forecasted transactions related to purchase commitments and sales&#xa0;denominated in various currencies. These derivative instruments are designated and qualify as cash flow hedges.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">The effectiveness of the cash flow hedges is determined by comparing the cumulative change in the fair value of the hedge contract with the cumulative change in the fair value of the hedged transaction, both of which are based on forward rates. The effective portion of the gain or loss on these cash flow hedges is initially recorded in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) as a separate component of stockholders&#x2019; equity. Once the hedged transaction is recognized, the gain or loss is recognized in our statement of operations. At <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>respectively, the following forward contracts were entered into to hedge against the volatility of foreign currency exchange rates for certain forecasted sales and purchases:</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfDerivativeInstrumentsInStatementOfFinancialPositionFairValueTextBlock" id="c00D706A7-1B16-4A08-A3E5-480C3E2138A3" escape="true" continuedAt="c63F3054C-BA79-40F1-B645-82EAFE3F650E">

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; width: 30.6%;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Foreign exchange contracts</p> </td>
       <td style="text-align: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:left;"><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">Prepaid and other</em></p> </td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">$</td>
       <td style="width: 12%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;"><ix:nonFraction id="c55013458" contextRef="i_2019-03-31_BalanceSheetLocationAxis-PrepaidExpensesAndOtherCurrentAssetsMember_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeContractMember_HedgingDesignationAxis-DesignatedAsHedgingInstrumentMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:DerivativeFairValueOfDerivativeAssetAmountNotOffsetAgainstCollateral" scale="3">570</ix:nonFraction></td>
       <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>

   </ix:continuation>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">For these derivatives designated as cash flow hedging instruments, during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended&#xa0;<em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>a&#xa0;net pre-tax loss&#xa0;of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013413" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeForwardMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:OtherComprehensiveIncomeUnrealizedGainLossOnDerivativesArisingDuringPeriodBeforeTax" sign="-" scale="3">26</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and a net pre-tax&#xa0;gain of&#xa0;$<ix:nonFraction id="c55013414" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeForwardMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:OtherComprehensiveIncomeUnrealizedGainLossOnDerivativesArisingDuringPeriodBeforeTax" scale="3">602</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, were recognized in other comprehensive income (loss). In addition, during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>net pre-tax losses of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013417" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeForwardMember_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-CostOfSalesMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax" sign="-" scale="3">76</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013418" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeForwardMember_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-CostOfSalesMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax" sign="-" scale="3">1,493</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, were reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) into cost of sales (for hedging purchases), and net pre-tax gains&#xa0;of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013419" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeForwardMember_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-SalesMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax" sign="-" scale="3">272</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013420" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeForwardMember_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-SalesMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnDerivativeInstrumentsNetPretax" sign="-" scale="3">1,496</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, were reclassified from accumulated other comprehensive income (loss) into sales (for hedging sales) in the accompanying statement of operations.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Derivatives <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> designated as cash flow hedging instruments consist primarily of forwards used to hedge foreign currency balance sheet exposures. These hedging instruments are used to offset foreign currency changes in the fair values of the underlying assets and liabilities. The gains and losses on these foreign currency forward contracts are recognized in other income (loss) in the same period as the remeasurement gains and losses of the related foreign currency denominated assets and liabilities and thus naturally offset these gains and losses. At <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>we had the following forward contracts that were entered into to hedge against these exposures.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <ix:continuation id="c912065B9-EF2F-4AC7-96D9-CC20FB51335F" continuedAt="c2C599C85-0F4D-4A86-9834-5AB944A065F2">
    <table class="finTable" style="width: 100%; font-size: 10pt; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; text-indent: 0px;" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0">
     <tbody>
      <tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>

       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td colspan="9" style="text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">Fair Value of Derivative Instruments</em></em></em></em></b></p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
      </tr>
      <tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
       <td colspan="4" style="text-align: center; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt; border-bottom: thin solid rgb(0, 0, 0);"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:center;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">Asset Derivatives</em></em></b></p> </td>
       <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; padding-bottom: 1px;">&#xa0;</td>

     <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
      <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">22</em>
     </div>
     <hr style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always; border: none; width: 100%; height: 2px; color: #000000; background-color: #000000" />
     <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
       &#xa0;
     </div>
    </div> <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p></ix:exclude>
   <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left"></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">For these derivatives <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">not</em> designated as cash flow hedging instruments during the <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">three</em> and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">nine</em> month periods ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>a gain&#xa0;of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013426" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-OtherExpenseMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-4" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsNotDesignatedAsHedgingInstrumentsGainLossNet" scale="3">80</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and a loss of $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013427" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-OtherExpenseMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsNotDesignatedAsHedgingInstrumentsGainLossNet" sign="-" scale="3">693</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, on hedging contracts were recognized in other income (loss), along with the approximately $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013428" contextRef="d_2019-10-01_2019-12-31_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-OtherIncomeMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsNotDesignatedAsHedgingInstrumentsGainLossNet" sign="-" scale="3">274</ix:nonFraction>&#xa0;and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013429" contextRef="d_2019-04-01_2019-12-31_IncomeStatementLocationAxis-OtherIncomeMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsNotDesignatedAsHedgingInstrumentsGainLossNet" sign="-" scale="3">1,054</ix:nonFraction>,&#xa0;respectively, in exchange losses that were recognized in other income (loss) in the accompanying statement of operations.</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">At <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> March 31, 2019 </em>and <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019, </em>we had outstanding foreign exchange contracts with notional amounts totaling $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013430" contextRef="i_2019-03-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeContractMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:DerivativeNotionalAmount" scale="3">216,555</ix:nonFraction> and $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013431" contextRef="i_2019-12-31_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis-ForeignExchangeContractMember" unitRef="USD" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="-3" name="us-gaap:DerivativeNotionalAmount" scale="3">271,038</ix:nonFraction>, respectively, denominated primarily in Euros, Czech Korunas, British Pounds, and Japanese Yen.</p>
  </ix:nonNumeric>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;&#xa0;&#xa0;</p>

    &#xa0;

   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><b><em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;">13.</em> Subsequent Events</b><b>:</b></p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
   <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">On <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2020-02-04_2020-02-04_SubsequentEventTypeAxis-SubsequentEventMember" name="us-gaap:DividendsPayableDateDeclaredDayMonthAndYear" id="c55013548" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">February 4, 2020</ix:nonNumeric>, </em>the Board of Directors of the Company declared a $<ix:nonFraction id="c55013546" contextRef="d_2020-02-04_2020-02-04_SubsequentEventTypeAxis-SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="USDPerShare" format="ixt:numdotdecimal" decimals="INF" name="us-gaap:CommonStockDividendsPerShareDeclared" scale="0">0.115</ix:nonFraction> dividend per share of common stock with respect to the quarter ended <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> December 31, 2019. </em>The dividend will be paid to stockholders of record on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2020-02-04_2020-02-04_SubsequentEventTypeAxis-SubsequentEventMember" name="us-gaap:DividendsPayableDateOfRecordDayMonthAndYear" id="c55013549" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">February 19, 2020</ix:nonNumeric> </em>and will be disbursed on <em style="font-weight: inherit; font-style: normal;"> <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="d_2020-02-04_2020-02-04_SubsequentEventTypeAxis-SubsequentEventMember" name="us-gaap:DividendPayableDateToBePaidDayMonthAndYear" id="c55013550" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">March 4, 2020</ix:nonNumeric>.</em></p>
   <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"><b></b></p><ix:exclude><p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;"><b>&#xa0;</b></p>

     <td style="vertical-align:top;width:10%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b><a id="item2" title="item2" href=""></a>ITEM 2.</b></p> </td>
     <td style="vertical-align:top;width:90%;"> <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt;text-align:justify;"><b>MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF&#xa0;FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</b></p> </td>

  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><span style="text-decoration: underline; ">Forward-Looking Statements</span></p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">This Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q contains &#x201c;forward-looking&#x201d; information within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. All statements other than statements of historical fact, including statements regarding industry prospects, trends and future results of operations or financial position, made in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q are forward-looking. The forward-looking information may include, among other information, statements concerning our outlook for future quarters or fiscal year 2020, overall volume and pricing trends, cost reduction and acquisition strategies and their anticipated results, and expectations for research and development and capital expenditures. There may also be other statements of expectations, beliefs, future plans and strategies, anticipated events or trends, and similar expressions concerning matters that are not historical facts. Forward-looking statements reflect management&#x2019;s expectations and are inherently uncertain. Our expectations and assumptions are expressed in good faith and we believe there is a reasonable basis for them. However, there can be no assurance that such forward-looking statements will materialize or prove to be correct as forward-looking statements are inherently subject to known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors which may cause actual future results, performance or achievements to differ materially from the future results, performance or achievements expressed in or implied by such forward-looking statements. Because these forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties, actual results could differ materially from those expressed or implied by the forward-looking statements for a variety of reasons, including without limitation, changes in the global economy or the economy of any locality in which we conduct business; changes in general industry and market conditions or regional growth or declines; loss of business from increased competition; higher raw material costs or raw material shortages; changes in consumer and customer preferences for end products; customer or supplier losses; changes in regulatory conditions; increased customs restrictions and tariffs or quotas; unfavorable fluctuations in currencies or interest rates among the various jurisdictions in which we operate; market acceptance of our new products; possible adverse results of pending or future litigation or infringement claims; our ability to realize expected synergies from acquired businesses; our ability to protect our intellectual property rights; negative impacts of environmental investigations or other governmental investigations and any associated litigation; tax assessments by governmental authorities and changes in our effective tax rate; dependence on and relationships with customers and suppliers; and other risks and uncertainties discussed in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for fiscal year ended March 31, 2019. Forward-looking statements should be read in context with, and with the understanding of, the various other disclosures concerning the Company and its business made elsewhere in this quarterly report as well as other public reports filed by the Company with the SEC. You should not place undue reliance on any forward-looking statements as a prediction of actual results or developments.</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Any forward-looking statements by the Company are intended to speak only as of the date thereof. We do not intend to update or revise any forward-looking statement contained in this quarterly report to reflect new events or circumstances unless and to the extent required by applicable law. All forward-looking statements contained in this quarterly report constitute &#x201c;forward-looking statements&#x201d; within the meaning of Section 21E of the United States Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the "Exchange Act"), and, to the extent it may be applicable by way of incorporation of statements contained in this quarterly report by reference or otherwise, Section 27A of the United States Securities Act of 1933, as amended,&#xa0;each of which establishes a safe-harbor from private actions for forward-looking statements as defined in those statutes.&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><span style="text-decoration: underline; ">Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates</span></p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#x201c;Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#x201d; is based upon our unaudited Consolidated Financial Statements and Notes thereto contained in this Form 10-Q, which have been prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles in the United States. The preparation of these financial statements requires management to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements,&#xa0;and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reported periods. On an ongoing basis, management evaluates its estimates and judgments, including those related to investment securities, revenue recognition, inventories, property and equipment, goodwill, intangible assets, income taxes, and contingencies. Management bases its estimates and judgments on historical experience and on various other factors that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances, the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other sources. There can be no assurance that actual results will not differ from those estimates.</p>
  <p style="font-family:'Times New Roman', Times, serif;font-size:10pt;margin:0pt 7.2pt;text-align:justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <div class="PGBK" style="width: 100%; margin-left: 0pt; margin-right: 0pt">
   <div class="PGNUM" style="text-align: center; width: 100%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">
     24
   </div>
   <hr />
   <div class="PGHDR" style="text-align: left; width: 100%">
     &#xa0;
   </div>
  </div>
  <p style="font-family: 'Times New Roman', Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We have identified the accounting policies and estimates that are critical to our business operations and understanding the Company&#x2019;s results of operations. Those policies and estimates can be found in Note 1, &#x201c;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies,&#x201d; in the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements and in &#x201c;Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates,&#x201d; in &#x201c;Management&#x2019;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#x201d; contained in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2019, and in Note 1, &#x201c;Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&#x201d; in the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements in this Form 10-Q. Accordingly, this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q should be read in conjunction with our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2019. There were no significant changes to critical accounting policies, judgments involved in applying those policies, or the methodology used in determining estimates with respect to those related to investment securities, inventories, goodwill, intangible assets, property and equipment, and contingencies, during the three and nine month periods ended December 31, 2019.&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: left;"><span style="text-decoration: underline; ">Business Overview</span></p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">AVX is a leading worldwide manufacturer, supplier, and reseller of a broad line of electronic components, interconnect, sensing and control devices, and related products. Electronic components and connector, sensing and control devices manufactured or resold by AVX are used in many types of end-use products, including those in telecommunications, automotive, transportation, energy harvesting, consumer electronics, military/aerospace, medical, computer, and industrial markets.&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">We have manufacturing, sales, and distribution facilities located throughout the world, which are divided into three geographic regions: the Americas, Asia, and Europe. AVX is organized into four product groups with two reportable segments: Electronic Components; and Interconnect, Sensing and Control Devices. The Electronic Components segment consists primarily of surface mount and leaded ceramic capacitors, RF thick and thin film components, surface mount and leaded tantalum capacitors, polymer tantalum capacitors, surface mount and leaded film capacitors, ceramic and film power capacitors, super capacitors, EMI filters (bolt in and surface mount), thick and thin film packages of multiple integrated components, varistors, thermistors, inductors, resistive products, and passive and active electronic antennas and antenna systems manufactured by us or purchased from other manufacturers for resale. The Interconnect, Sensing and Control Devices segment consists primarily of automotive sensing and control devices and automotive, telecom, and memory connectors manufactured by, or for, AVX.</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Our customers consist of multi-national original equipment manufacturers, or OEMs, independent electronic component distributors, and electronic manufacturing service providers, or EMSs. We market our products through our own direct sales force and independent manufacturers&#x2019; representatives, based upon market characteristics and demands. We coordinate our sales, marketing, and manufacturing organizations by strategic customer account and globally by region.</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;"><span style="text-decoration: underline; ">Results of Operations - Three Months Ended </span><span style="text-decoration: underline; ">December 31</span><span style="text-decoration: underline; ">, 2018 and 2019</span></p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">Our net income for the three months ended December 31, 2019 was $47.9&#xa0;million, or $0.28&#xa0;per share, compared to net income of $74.3 million, or $0.44 per share, for the three months ended December 31, 2018.</p>
  <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin: 0pt; text-align: justify;">&#xa0;</p>

     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>

    <tr style="background-color: rgb(204, 238, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
     <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Operating income</p> </td>
     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
     <td style="width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">89,556</td>
     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;">&#xa0;</td>
     <td style="width: 14%; text-align: right; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">35,869</td>
     <td style="width: 1%; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-left: 0pt;">&#xa0;</td>
    </tr>
    <tr style="background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); vertical-align: bottom">
     <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Net income</p> </td>

     <td style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt;"> <p style="font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, serif; font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt;">Diluted earnings per share</p> </td>
